[File: src/traits.rs] [Trait: Signer] [Function: compute_intermediate()] [Critical: Message Binding] Does compute_intermediate() bind the message parameter into binding value computation, or can the same binding be used across different messages?

[File: src/traits.rs] [Trait: Signer] [Function: compute_intermediate()] [Critical: Nonce Aggregation] Does compute_intermediate() correctly aggregate public nonces using the binding values, preventing malicious nonce injection?

[File: src/traits.rs] [Trait: Signer] [Function: compute_intermediate()] [High: Signer ID Validation] Does compute_intermediate() validate that signer_ids array matches the expected set of participating signers?

[File: src/traits.rs] [Trait: Signer] [Function: compute_intermediate()] [High: Key ID Validation] Does compute_intermediate() verify that key_ids contains no duplicates and all values are within [0, num_keys)?

[File: src/traits.rs] [Trait: Signer] [Function: compute_intermediate()] [High: Nonce Count] Does compute_intermediate() verify that nonces array length matches key_ids length, preventing index mismatches?

[File: src/traits.rs] [Trait: Signer] [Function: compute_intermediate()] [Medium: Empty Inputs] Can compute_intermediate() be called with empty signer_ids or key_ids arrays, causing division by zero or invalid Point returns?

[File: src/traits.rs] [Trait: Signer] [Function: compute_intermediate()] [Medium: Identity Point] Can compute_intermediate() return identity point as the aggregated nonce R, causing signature verification failures?

[File: src/traits.rs] [Trait: Signer] [Function: validate_party_id()] [High: Authorization Bypass] Can validate_party_id() return true for a party_id that doesn't actually belong to signer_id, enabling unauthorized signing?

[File: src/traits.rs] [Trait: Signer] [Function: validate_party_id()] [High: Key ID Mapping] Does validate_party_id() correctly check that party_id owns at least one key_id in signer_key_ids for the given signer_id?

[File: src/traits.rs] [Trait: Signer] [Function: validate_party_id()] [Medium: Empty Key Set] Can validate_party_id() return true when signer_key_ids has an empty set for signer_id, accepting any party_id?
[File: src/traits.rs] [Trait: Signer] [Function: validate_party_id()] [Medium: Missing Signer] Can validate_party_id() return true when signer_id is not present in signer_key_ids HashMap?

[File: src/traits.rs] [Trait: Signer] [Function: sign()] [Critical: Signature Share Validation] Does sign() validate that all inputs (signer_ids, key_ids, nonces) are consistent before generating signature shares?

[File: src/traits.rs] [Trait: Signer] [Function: sign()] [Critical: Lagrange Coefficients] Does sign() compute Lagrange coefficients correctly using the exact key_ids set, or can coefficient errors enable forgery?

[File: src/traits.rs] [Trait: Signer] [Function: sign()] [Critical: Challenge Computation] Does sign() compute the challenge hash binding the message, all nonces, and public key, preventing signature malleability?
[File: src/traits.rs] [Trait: Signer] [Function: sign()] [Critical: Private Key Usage] Does sign() use the correct private key for each owned key_id when computing signature shares?
[File: src/traits.rs] [Trait: Signer] [Function: sign()] [Critical: Nonce Usage] Does sign() use fresh nonces that match the provided public nonces array, preventing nonce reuse?
[File: src/traits.rs] [Trait: Signer] [Function: sign()] [High: Share Count] Does sign() return exactly one SignatureShare per owned key_id, or can extra/missing shares break aggregation?
[File: src/traits.rs] [Trait: Signer] [Function: sign()] [High: Key ID Filtering] Does sign() only generate signature shares for key_ids owned by this signer, ignoring others?

[File: src/traits.rs] [Trait: Signer] [Function: sign()] [Medium: Empty Key Set] Can sign() be called when this signer owns no key_ids in the provided key_ids array, and does it return empty Vec or error?

[File: src/traits.rs] [Trait: Signer] [Function: sign_schnorr()] [Critical: BIP-340 Compliance] Does sign_schnorr() follow BIP-340 even-Y parity rules for the aggregated R point when computing challenges?

[File: src/traits.rs] [Trait: Signer] [Function: sign_schnorr()] [Critical: Parity Adjustment] Does sign_schnorr() negate nonces correctly when R has odd Y coordinate, preventing signature verification failures?

[File: src/traits.rs] [Trait: Signer] [Function: sign_schnorr()] [Critical: Public Key Parity] Does sign_schnorr() apply even-Y adjustment to the group public key before challenge computation per BIP-340?
[File: src/traits.rs] [Trait: Signer] [Function: sign_schnorr()] [High: Challenge Domain] Does sign_schnorr() use a different challenge hash domain than sign() to prevent cross-protocol attacks?
[File: src/traits.rs] [Trait: Signer] [Function: sign_schnorr()] [High: Signature Format] Does sign_schnorr() return signature shares compatible with BIP-340 proof aggregation?

[File: src/traits.rs] [Trait: Signer] [Function: sign_schnorr()] [Medium: Consistency] Does sign_schnorr() use the same Lagrange coefficients and binding values as sign(), or can inconsistencies cause failures?
